short_description: DHCS requires a specific "Outreach Tracker File" for members not yet enrolled.
additional_note:
This is likely a “modularized” entry that captures several fields: 
Outreach Date: (MM/DD/YYYY).
Outreach Attempt Type:
• Values: In-Person, Telephonic, Electronic (Text/Email), Mail, Community Settings.
Outreach Outcome:
• Values: Successful (Member reached), Unsuccessful (Voicemail/No Answer), Declined.
Total Minutes of Outreach: Duration of the attempt.
Staff ID: The NPI or ID of the staff member attempting outreach (this can be done via User_assignment tag).
author: System Import

short_description: Members must be tagged to one or more of DHCS-defined populations to justify eligibility.
additional_note:
This can be a boolean selection across one of the multiple POF’s defined by DHCS (e.g. “Individuals experiencing homelessness” or “Severe Mental Illness / Substance Use Disorder”

The system will need to be able to track this historically (e.g. if a patient / client switches POFs, a historical record must be preserved for audit purposes).
author: System Import

short_description: The name of the “Lead Care Manager” for each patient / client enrolled in ECM
additional_note: An admin (Manager of ECM services) needs to designate which lead care manager each ECM patient is enrolled with, this is a required field for MCP reporting.
author: System Import

short_description: Explanation for why a patient / client is no longer receiving ECM services
additional_note: These must conform to DHCS standard reason codes and are required for reporting to MCPs on a discontinuation of services to a patient / client (e.g., "Member declined," "Unable to contact," "Met goals").
author: System Import

short_description: Standardized race / ethnicity code
additional_note: Standardized codes for tracking / reporting / service delivery
author: System Import

short_description: The plan for navigating a patient from their current homeless status into either interim or permanent housing
additional_note:
A structured plan developed at / near intake depending on the program the patient / client is enrolled in. The Housing Assistance Plan will include multiple fields and should ensure compliance with the minimum standards outlined by DHCS and the payer (these standards are loosely defined though there are some required fields). The Housing Assistance Plan is required for the Prior Authorization process, and is also a foundational tool for multiple CS service delivery models.

Similar to the care plan, the Housing Assistance Plan will also need to capture certain administrative data for MCP reporting:

Initial Assessment Date: Date the comprehensive assessment was completed.
Completion Date: Date the individualized care plan was signed/finalized.
Update Date: Date of the most recent revision.
Case Manager Information:
• Name.
• Contact Phone/Email.
author: System Import

short_description: The plan for managing the patient / client’s needs specific to their program enrollment
additional_note:
A structured plan developed at / near intake depending on the program the patient / client is enrolled in. The care plan will include multiple fields and should ensure compliance with the minimum standards outlined by DHCS and the payer. The Care Plan is required for the Prior Authorization process, and is also a foundational tool for ECM and many CS service delivery models. 

Beyond the service content, this care plan will also need to capture certain administrative dates required for MCP reporting:

Initial Assessment Date: Date the comprehensive assessment was completed.
Care Plan Completion Date: Date the individualized care plan was signed/finalized.
Care Plan Update Date: Date of the most recent revision.
Lead Care Manager (LCM) Information:
• LCM Name.
• LCM Contact Phone/Email.
• LCM NPI (if clinical).
author: System Import

short_description: Does the CPT Code require authorization?
additional_note: This is not a required field in a claim, but is essential for general revenue cycle management. Identifying when a service requires a prior authorization is essential and should trigger a parallel prior authorization workflow by, ideally, a single individual inside the organization that will complete two steps: submit the prior authorization request through the payer portal (this is a manual process, unfortunately), and log the prior authorization request details into the prior authorization module inside of DSS’s RCM tool). Once that Prior Auth is then approved, a PA Number and the effective dates for the PA can be updated in the PA module, and the claiming tool will begin to process those claims accordingly (e.g. the submission tool will have held back claims for any service that do not have an active PA).
author: System Import

short_description: Code used to identify a payer for claims submission interface.
additional_note: The national payer code used to route claims to the correct payer (e.g. HealthNet claims are submitted to Centene’s NPI unless you are in WA, etc…)
author: System Import

short_description: M or F
additional_note: This can be coded any number of ways in the case management system, but back-end logic will need to transform all inputted values into either binary sex of: M or F

field_requirement: Other: Not used currently but reserved for future use or custom use.

short_description: Authorization or referral number
additional_note: A PA number is essential for certain claims submission, and attaching a PA number and ensuring that claims are only submitted during active dates for PA is something that a billing module in concert with a PA tracking module can manage.

field_requirement: Dependent: Based on claim resubmission status: use code “7” (replacement) or “8” (void).
short_description: When resubmitting a corrected claim
additional_note: This is a field that can be placed by a back-end billing module or solution through the post-submission adjudication process.
author: System Import

field_requirement: Other: If services billed were done by an outside lab.
short_description: Check if an external lab performed the test
additional_note: Not required
author: System Import

field_requirement: Other: Payer-specific; used frequently for Medicare or compounding drugs.
short_description: Notes to payer, drug info, investigational use, etc.
additional_note: Not required
author: System Import

field_requirement: Other: Required if services relate to inpatient stay.
short_description: Admission and discharge dates
additional_note: This is not a required field for ECM, CS or CHW billing, though is a helpful piece of data to capture and may be required at a future data for Post Hospitalization Medical Respite Care. At this point we would recommend capturing this date
author: System Import

field_requirement: Dependent: Required if Box 17 is completed.
short_description: National Provider Identifier of referring provider
additional_note: Linked to the “referring provider name” this is not a required field for ECM, CS, or CHW billing at present, but is likely an important field to capture for analytics or performance tracking purposes.
author: System Import

short_description: Legacy ID if required by payer
additional_note: Not necessary, this is a deprecated field by nearly all payers
author: System Import

field_requirement: Dependent: primarily for labs, imaging, therapy, specialist visits.
short_description: Required when a referral or order is involved
additional_note: This is likely unnecessary for claiming purposes, though would represent a leading practice for care coordination and could be useful for analytics purposes (e.g. tracking referral sources) or operational compliance (e.g. “closed loop referral” completions).
author: System Import

field_requirement: Dependent: For disability claims or work-related injuries.
short_description: If patient was unable to work due to condition
additional_note: This is a dependent field that is required for disability claims or worker’s comp claims, though it could be collected at either intake or in clinical notes depending on when an injury occurs. It may be best practice to include this as a “gated” value that is available only if a previous field related to a disability has been activated.
author: System Import

field_requirement: Other: Based on payer rules or specific CPT/ICD usage.
short_description: Additional relevant dates (e.g., same/similar illness)
additional_note: Box 15 captures a secondary date related to the patient's condition or treatment history AND an explanation of what that date is. The explanation, on a claim form is a three-digit code which corresponds to a common set of reasons that can be pre-populated in a drop-down menu (e.g. “Initial Treatment”, “Accident date”, “Last X-Ray”)
author: System Import

field_requirement: Dependent: Required for workers’ comp or accident-related claims.
short_description: Indicates whether services were due to employment, auto accident, or other accident
additional_note: This is likely not required for any Medi-Cal patient, though it could be helpful data to capture for general care coordination / analytics purposes. It is also required for any worker’s compensation claims or any accident-related claims.
author: System Import

short_description: Full name of secondary plan
additional_note: Medi-Cal eligibility is based on the individual thought we should discuss whether there are cases in which this could be a relevant field

short_description: If secondary insurance is through employer/school

short_description: Consistent code that can be translated/customized by payer
additional_note: We have seen drop-down menus for services (e.g. “clinical team consultation” or “individual patient session”) work well. There can be multiple menus attached to the “Program” that the patient or client is enrolled in (e.g. ECM, or Housing Transition and Navigation Services). These values can then be matched against billing codes, modifiers, and rates on the back end for claims submission.
program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management
author: System Import

short_description: National Provider Identifier.
additional_note: This will be the information for whomever your billing provider is (e.g. if it is the Co-Lab it would be our NPI and service address)
author: System Import

short_description: Name, address, phone number.
additional_note: This will be the information for whomever your billing provider is (e.g. if it is the Co-Lab it would be our NPI and service address)
author: System Import

short_description: Start date MM/DD/YYYY
additional_note: We will need to affix a data of service to any qualifying “encounter” whether its a phone call to patient / client, a consultation with another clinician, etc… These individual service dates may not be required for billing purposes now, but may be needed at a future date, and are necessary for audit purposes (for example, CCAH is now requiring evidence of at least two patient encounters / billing month for housing transition and navigation services).
program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

short_description: Unique CCS system identifier for matching clinical and billing data
additional_note: Unique CCS system identifier for matching clinical and billing data
program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management
author: System Import

short_description: If any prior payments received.
additional_note: This would be applicable to any claims that have been “partially paid” and the claim is being resubmitted for either the remainder of the balance or some additional fees attached to the same encounter. This is a function that should be managed by a billing module, or RCM solution.
author: System Import

short_description: Address where service was delivered
additional_note: This would be the address for each corresponding POS code
program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management
author: System Import

short_description: ICD-10 codes (up to 12); use letters (A-L) to link to services.
additional_note: For ECM and CS services, this needs to ultimately be submitted as as “Z-Code” which is based on a social determinant of health as opposed to a traditional clinical health diagnosis. Z-Codes Z-55-65 cover the acceptable Dx codes for ECM and CS service delivery (e.g. Z59.00 = homeless, unspecified, Z59.01 = Sheltered Homeless). An SDOH or HRSN screener will be the best source of these diagnosis codes. This Dx data is needed for both claiming, and also in certain cases (e.g. some ECM patients without a referral and all CS services) for prior authorization submission.
program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management
author: System Import

short_description: EIN or SSN of billing entity.
additional_note: This is the EIN / SSN of the provider facility (in this case, DOH as they hold the contract)
author: System Import

short_description: Indication that signature is on file (Y / N)
additional_note: This can likely be collected at the start / end of a providers employment period and kept in an Admin panel
program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management
author: System Import

short_description: Required if different from billing.
additional_note: This will be the service facility that DSS primarily uses and will be populated on each claim as the NPI will be different from DOH.
author: System Import

short_description: Indication that signature is on file (Y / N)
additional_note: Required if the patient / client is not the insured individual (this likely will not be the case for Medi-Cal patients as eligibility is individually determined, but should still be an accessible field.
program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management
author: System Import

short_description: Letter(s) from Box 21 (e.g., A, B).
additional_note: The Dx pointer is where the claim indicates which procedure (HCPCS/CPT does) is associated with which diagnosis. Pointers are only required for service claims that have multiple diagnosis. Pointer logic should be handled by a billing module or RCM solution based on programmed logic.
author: System Import

short_description: Required for certain CPTs or ICDs.
additional_note: Depending on workflow considerations, this could be captured at the front end or in the middle in service notes. A best practice would be to capture it at patient / client registration, so that a prior authorization could be filed immediately for applicable services (e.g. ECM or CS patients without active prior auth)
author: System Import

short_description: CPT/HCPCS code + any required modifiers.
additional_note: Qualifying CPT / HCPCS codes and modifiers should be attached to claims based on the details included in the signed provider agreement. Codes will be attached to individual claims files based on the patient / clients active Prior Authorization status and service notes.
author: System Import

short_description: Sum of all charges from Box 24F.
additional_note: This is a back-end billing module or RCM solution that calculates the charges across multiple procedures (if the claim includes multiple HCPCS / CPT codes) and affixes the total into the correct claim field (box 28)
author: System Import

short_description: Check YES to receive payment from insurer.
additional_note: This will likely always be a “Yes” and is the provider (in this case DOH), telling the payer that they will accept the payers allowed rates, or those outlined in the contract.
author: System Import

short_description: 2-digit location code
additional_note: There are likely only two options for this code (e.g. 04 = Homeless Shelter, 27 = Outreach site / street). It is essential that we collect this correctly though, so an option of location should be included for each service note (this also has implications on remote v in person which is specifically captured in another field)
program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management
author: System Import

short_description: Unit calculations may vary by service (see notes)
additional_note: CHW is billed based on a count of 30 minute work unit blocks, Housing Navigation and Tenancy Support is based on a count of any qualifying encounter, tracking ECM “minutes” also represents a leading practice and would be our recommended approach.
program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management
author: System Import

short_description: Fee for each service line.
additional_note: Valid CPT codes will be cross-walked with contractually identified rates and claims will be submitted with valid fees attached. This is a function managed by a billing module or RCM solution.
author: System Import

short_description: Indication that signature is on file (Y / N)
additional_note: This is a Yes / No answer that will be collected at intake and will need to be re-authorized annually.
